author: Amanda Angus
title: Fiesta time: discover Spain’s vibrant festivals
text: Every region of Spain has its own identity and quirks and Saga Holiday Hunter Richard has spent years exploring its many facets. “I enjoyed an amazing year in Bilbao while I was studying,” he explains. “And my enthusiasm for the culture has stayed with me. "I think it’s important that the customers we take to Spain get to experience the same things I fell in love with all those years ago. For example, the fiestas that punctuate the Spanish calendar. “I toured the country with friends, soaking up the incomparable atmosphere of fantastic celebrations such as the raucous San Fermin at Pamplona and the elegant spectacle of the April Fair in Seville. They speak volumes of the local people’s zest for life, and I knew we needed to include events like these in our holidays. “So in Dénia, for example, our customers can enjoy the week-long Fallas, the main festival of the year. Here, amid fireworks and live music, painstakingly created papier maché floats and beautiful religious effigies are paraded through the town. As late as 2am, you’ll see everyone from toddlers to grandparents in the streets and, even though you’re a visitor, you feel included "The best one is chosen to go into a museum, and the others are burnt on a colossal bonfire on midnight of the last day – it’s certainly a spectacular sight! “My work took me out to pretty Aguilas on the coast of Murcia recently. Here, Carnival is a very big deal indeed. It’s an integral part of the culture, where the whole family is involved. "As late as 2am, you’ll see everyone from toddlers to grandparents in the streets, and even though you’re a visitor, you don’t feel like an onlooker, you feel included. “In short, these celebrations are a sacred part of life in Spain and offer the best chance to meet the locals and enjoy a manzanilla sherry or two – that’s the experience I want our customers to have.” You may also like to read »» • Very interesting: take your hobby on holiday • Authentic holidays: immerse yourself in the real Cuba • Croatia’s top five Unesco World Heritage Sites For the latest travel news, sign up to the fortnightly Saga Navigator newsletter , or follow @SagaHolidaysUK
